modules.title: Primer to Climate Scenarios
modules.description: This interactive primer give an introduction to climate change scenarios are and how they are connected to socioeconomics, energy & land use, emissions, climate change and climate impacts.
modules.subtitle: Learn module
modules.keywords: projection pathway ssp socioeconomic emissions concentration climate change impact mitigation adaptation integrated iam integrated assessment model

modules.title: Towards an electric future
modules.description: We cannot predict the future, but we can create different plausible scenarios of how a future decarbonization pathway could look like. In this module you will be introduced to the concept of Electrification and to the broad strategy to go Carbon Neutral by reducing emissions.
modules.subtitle: Learn module

modules.title: National and sectoral transition paths II
modules.subtitle: Learn module

modules.title: What is the potential impact of the demand side?
modules.subtitle: Learn module

modules.title: Land Transitions
modules.description: Today, most of the global ice-free land is used by humans in some way or another. Land use change and sustainable land management play an important role in climate change adaptation and mitigation. But they also have an impact on food security, desertification, land degradation.
modules.keywords: population income calorie crop demand fish livestock supply chain food rice meat cereals rangelands cropland forest urban sugar nitrogen
modules.subtitle: Learn module

modules.title: Senses Earth
modules.description: Discover how different regions will be impacted by extreme events in the next 100 years.
modules.subtitle: Explore module

modules.title: Investment Opportunities and Alignment
modules.description: What are near-time investment requirements for meeting stringent climate targets in a low carbon world?
modules.subtitle: Learn module

modules.title: Fossil Fuels Risks
modules.subtitle: Learn module
modules.description: Discover finance risks related to transitions in a variety of sectors including: Fossil fuels, End User and Power

modules.title: Primary Energy Scenarios
modules.description: Learn about the concept of primary energy sources like coal, oil and solar radiation. This module explains conversion processes and scenarios in the SSP worlds.
modules.subtitle: Learn module

modules.title: Scenario Finder
modules.subtitle: Explore module
modules.description: This explore module allows you to quickly filter all avialable scenarios from the IAMC 1.5 database

modules.title: Co-Creation Techniques Finder
modules.subtitle: Explore module
modules.description: This explore module allows you to quickly filter co-creation techniques

modules.title: Risk Finder
modules.subtitle: Explore module
modules.description: This explore module allows you to quickly filter risks

modules.title: Global Stocktake
modules.description: This general explores how current decarbonization plans until 2030 relate to the long-term targets of the Paris Agreement.
modules.subtitle: Learn module
modules.keywords: decarbonization plan paris agreement target emission gap carbon budget temperature stranded assets land use investment cost-effective policies policy mitigation technology cdr carbon dioxide removal short term long bridge scenario

modules.title: Co-creating scenarios: Step-by-step guide
modules.subtitle: Learn module
modules.description: Practitioners’ step-by-step guide to co-producing socioeconomic Scenarios with Stakeholders to strengthening the link between global and regional scenarios using co-production techniques.

modules.title: Scenario Explorer
modules.subtitle: Database
modules.description: This Scenario Explorer presents an ensemble of quantitative, model-based climate change mitigation pathways.

modules.title: A Brief History Of CO2 Emissions
modules.subtitle: Learn film
modules.description: Greenhouse gas emissions are one of the driving forces behind climate change. In our short film “A Brief History of CO2 Emissions”, we visualize the geographic distribution and the historic dimension of carbon dioxide emissions.

modules.title: Extreme Events
modules.subtitle: Learn module
modules.description: The extent and impact of crop failures, river floods, tropical cyclones, heatwaves, wildfires, and droughts depend on the underlying meteorological, hydrological, or climatological events as well as on human factors such as land use, water and agricultural management, and population density.
